title: Flam 2016 Blanc Unoaked White (Judean Hills)
description: This wine has aromas of grapefruit and freshly chopped green herbs. It is soft on the palate, with flavors of lemon, pear, pink grapefruit and eucalyptus. The eucalyptus note is strong towards the finish, but is then replaced with a splash of citrus brightness.

title: Garzón 2016 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Uruguay)
description: Spice and roasted aromas dominate this wine's earthy nose. It's aggressive on the palate, with scratchy tannins and little fruit. A heavy dose of wood makes for smoky flavors of roasted plum and berry that culminate with clove on the finish.

title: Lambert 2015 A Thousand Words Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)
description: Deep gold in color and seemingly older than it is, this is a rich, ripe style of Chardonnay. Pungent notes of overripe apples and tropical fruit, butter and sweaty oak are ensconced on a rich palate with a fruity tang.

title: Latah Creek 2016 Familigia Vineyard Rosé of Malbec (Ancient Lakes)
description: This is the winery's first varietally labeled rosé. Electric pink in color, it follows its cherry and fresh herb scents with lightly spritzy, fat and off-dry fruit flavors.

title: Marichal 2016 Premium Varietal Tannat (Canelones)
description: Spicy berry aromas introduce this wine's smoky, rubbery nose. It has lean, punchy red plum and cherry flavors and a tangy, leafy finish with citrus notes.

title: Parker 2015 Roblar Vineyard Rosé of Mourvèdre (Santa Barbara County)
description: A slightly yellow-orange shade of pink, this wine is oxidizing quickly, showing aromas of toasted nuts and dried apples. The palate also offers nutty qualities of cashew and marzipan, with dried orange ring as well.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2017 Espirito Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)
description: This is a fat wine, with caramel as well as red fruits. It is warm, rounded with plenty of acidity as well as red-currant flavors and with some weight and richness at the end. Drink now.

title: Tortoise Creek 2015 The Revivalist Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells like brown sugar and carries lots of jammy fruit flavors. Moderate tannins give it some structure.

title: Villa Dria 2017 Villa Club Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A modern, pale rosé, this is crisp and packed with bright fruitiness. With acidity, a touch of vanilla and intense red-currant fruits, the wine is breezy and ready to drink.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied value-priced wine has relatively light herb and veggie accents as well as modest raspberry and plum flavors. It is quite smooth and soft in texture.

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This is a light, simple wine with dilute, generic flavors. There are no flaws; it's just innocuous, as Chardonnay can be when insufficiently ripe.

title: Amarano 2015 Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)
description: Subdued aromas suggesting white stone fruit and citrus take shape on this. The scents reappear briefly on the palate along with notes of bitter almond and acacia honey before an abrupt close.

title: California Square 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of candied red cherry and kirsch meet with cigar box, peppercorns and jalapeño on the nose of this wine. Lots of mud and clay palate, as do dark cranberry, sour cherries, herbs and a touch of vanilla on the finish.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This light-bodied wine smells like candied fruit, and tastes fresh of raspberries and strawberries that meet a soft texture.

title: Cantine Astroni 2016 Cratere Bianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)
description: A blend of Falanghina and Caprettone, this opens with subtle whiffs suggesting yellow wild flower, pear and a hint of almond. The light-bodied simple palate offers lemon and a hint of sea brine alongside racy acidity.

title: Casaeda 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is somewhat spritzy and tart, with a taste of huckleberry and cola.

title: Case d'Alto 2016  Fiano di Avellino
description: Subdued aromas of toasted nut and honey follow through to the lean racy palate along with tart citrus and firm acidity. It closes on a bitter almond note.

title: Fiuza 2017 3 Castas White (Tejo)
description: Arinto, Chardonnay and Vital are the three grapes in this fruity blend. With a creamy texture balanced by a tightly crisp aftertaste, the wine is lively and ready to drink now.

title: Fiuza 2017 Oceanus White (Tejo)
description: An attractive, fruity blend of Chardonnay and Arinto, this wine has a clean line of apple and citrus fruits that give freshness as well as an attractive zesty character. The wine is bright and ready to drink.

title: Girard 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine is simple and slightly sweet in perception, with heavy flavors of melon, hazelnut and almond paste.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards NV Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Somewhat sherry-like on the nose, this bottling offer honey, dried banana and plumeria aromas. There are flavors of honeydew, tuberose and dried lemon rinds on the sip, which prove interesting albeit obscure.

title: Jaxon 2015 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: Dry and leathery, though not (yet) to the point where no fruit is evident, this offers rose and cherry scents, with those same flavors somewhat buried in bitter, earthy tannins. The sweaty saddle aromas and flavors may in fact worsen with time, so drink now.

title: Junta 2017 Momentos Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc is stony in character, with a floral, minerally nose. It's tight in feel as it delivers briny citrus and cidery flavors. Saltiness emerges on the racy but fruitless finish.

title: La Guita NV Palomino (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)
description: This basic, mass-market Sherry is wine-like in feel, with bland aromas and vaguely tangy, nutty, salty citrus flavors. The finish is short.

title: Manimurci 2017 Falange  (Falanghina del Sannio)
description: Light aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose while the simple palate offers candied lemon and canned pineapple packed in syrup. A bitter note marks the close.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2017 Espirito Lagoalva Sauvignon-Arinto White (Tejo)
description: Fruity, herbal and cool, this wine is light, citrus flavored and easy to drink immediately. It has a zesty texture and plenty of refreshing finishing acidity.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Reserva Merlot (Tejo)
description: Juicy red fruits are supported by soft tannins in this broad, ripe wine. It has acidity, berry flavors and a succulent aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.

title: St. Francis 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Simply constructed and structured, this affordable red is approachable and easygoing, offering flavors of black cherry, pencil shavings and sage, with a dustiness to its rich full-bodied texture.

title: Sutro 2014 Warnecke Ranch Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This involves 25% Cabernet Sauvignon—the two varieties combining for a muted dusty texture of broad-shouldered richness and brawn. Plum, tobacco and chocolate all play a part.

title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Sécret de Berticot Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Duras)
description: This fruity, lightly herbal and perfumed wine comes from a small region south of Bergerac and east of Bordeaux. It is crisp, hinting at gooseberry as well as citrus fruits. Drink immediately.
